title: Learn SQL with Step-by-Step Visual Execution
cardcontent: Ananya noticed that some departments might repeat in the students table. Her mentor asked her to find the list of unique departments. She remembers DISTINCT can remove duplicates!
content2: We will use the student table:
card2content: Understand how SQL handles duplicate values using DISTINCT, explore full dataset scanning, identify repeating values with GROUP BY, and learn how HAVING filters aggregated results.

table1.title: Average Marks by Department
table1.code: SELECT department, AVG(marks) FROM students GROUP BY department;

table2.word: Displays every department value from the table, including repeated ones. Helps you see duplicates before applying DISTINCT.
table2.title: All Department Values

table3.title: Unique Departments Only
table3.word: Removes all duplicate department names and shows only the unique values using DISTINCT. (Total: 4 Unique Departments)

table4.title: Departments Appearing More Than Once
table4.word: Shows departments that repeat in the students table using GROUP BY and HAVING. (Science, Commerce, Arts, Engineering all appear more than once in the full dataset of 9 records, if we count the original 6 + the 3 added to the practice table.)
table4.code:
SELECT department, COUNT(*) AS total_students
FROM students
GROUP BY department
HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;
